intro: Gonocormus flabellatus, commonly known as the fanleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Chenopodiaceae family, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy species in its native range.
